title: Mahabharata | Part 48 | Brhannala to the rescue | His Grace Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa
speaker: HG Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa

segments.key_quote: Now that the disguise of the Pandavas was discovered, Duryodhana became very happy.
segments.summary: Arjuna reveals himself as Brahmanala, leading to Duryodhana's elation due to the terms of the Game of Dice.

segments.key_quote: And the whole purpose of Duryodhana coming to Virata was that only to uncover the disguise of the Pandavas.
segments.summary: Duryodhana is happy because he thinks the Pandavas will have to return to exile, while Karna boasts about defeating Arjuna.

segments.key_quote: Challenging Arjuna to battle if anyone who challenges Arjuna to battle he must really have gone off his senses.
segments.summary: Kripacharya warns Karna about Arjuna's power, and Ashwatthama criticizes Karna's lack of battlefield achievements.

segments.key_quote: The one year of living incognito which the Pandavas had to complete got over yesterday so today that is why Arjuna has revealed himself.
segments.summary: Bhishma pacifies the argument and reveals that the Pandavas' exile period is over, mortifying Duryodhana.

segments.key_quote: Look look look Duryodhana is trying to get away let us go and corner him.
segments.summary: Duryodhana tries to steal the cows, but Arjuna intercepts him and forces him to rejoin the Kaurava army.

segments.key_quote: Duryodhana did not have the courage to face Arjuna alone in battle.
segments.summary: Duryodhana retreats to the safety of his army, and Karna is defeated by Arjuna and forced to flee.

segments.key_quote: Arjuna is sending his respects but now having given having submitted his respects now he is not going to hold back so let us get ready.
segments.summary: Arjuna fights Dronacharya and Bhishma, overpowering them, and the Kaurava army struggles against him.

segments.key_quote: Arjuna very quickly and very easily defeated Duryodhana, but he did not want to kill him.
segments.summary: Arjuna defeats Duryodhana but spares his life, and the Kaurava army retreats, Arjuna gives the spoils of war to Bhuminjaya and asks him to take credit for the victory.

segments.key_quote: The kauravas had been defeated and they had gone back and king virata was extremely pleased and he was surprised oh my dear son boominjaya you are so powerful you have defeated the kauravas
segments.summary: Bhuminjaya returns to the kingdom, and King Virata is overjoyed, attributing the victory to a celestial being.

segments.key_quote: This is Arjuna who was here as Brihannala.
segments.summary: The Pandavas reveal their true identities to King Virata, who is shocked and happy to have hosted them.

segments.key_quote: And so he felt guilty that he had mistreated the Pandavas.
segments.summary: The Pandavas reveal Draupadi's identity and the story of Keechaka, and King Virata feels guilty for mistreating the Pandavas and offers his daughter Uttara in marriage to Arjuna.

segments.key_quote: How can that be possible i have been her teacher so as a teacher i am in the position of her father i cannot marry her.
segments.summary: Arjuna refuses to marry Uttara due to their guru-disciple relationship, demonstrating his unimpeachable character.

segments.key_quote: Arjuna's son Abhimanyu was getting married to his daughter Uttara so various Kings came from different places they brought various kinds of gifts and they came to express their solidarity and support for the Pandavas.
segments.summary: Arjuna proposes marriage between Abhimanyu and Uttara, solidifying the alliance, and the Pandavas begin planning how to reclaim their kingdom.
